text: {{Infobox settlement | = | population_total = 78,908 | population_blank1_title = Ethnicities | population_density_metro_sq_mi = | population_density_metro_km2 = | population_metro = | population_density_sq_mi = | population_density_km2 = 24212 | population_note = figures from 2 January 2018 (UNHCR) | population_density_blank1_km2 = | population_footnotes = | population_as_of = 2015 | area_land_km2 = | area_total_km2 = 5.2 | area_footnotes = | unit_pref = Imperial | area_magnitude = | population_blank1 = | population_density_blank1_sq_mi = | established_title2 = | postal_code = | website = | blank1_info = | blank1_name = | blank_info = | blank_name = | area_code = +(962)2 | postal_code_type = | timezone = UTC+2 | elevation_ft = | elevation_m = | elevation_footnotes = | coordinates = | utc_offset_DST = +3 | timezone_DST = UTC+3 | utc_offset = +2 | established_date2 = | established_date = July 2012 | name = Zaatari | image_flag = | image_map = | shield_size = | image_shield = | seal_size = | image_seal = | flag_size = 180px | image_caption = | map_caption = | imagesize = 300px | image_skyline = File:An_Aerial_View_of_the_Za%27atri_Refugee_Camp.jpg | motto = | settlement_type = Refugee camp | nickname = | native_name = مخيم الزعتري | other_name = | mapsize = | pushpin_map = Jordan | established_title = Settled | subdivision_type3 = | leader_name1 = | leader_title1 = | leader_name = Hovig Etyemezian | leader_title = Camp Manager | government_type = | government_footnotes = | subdivision_name3 = | subdivision_name2 = | pushpin_label_position = bottom | subdivision_type2 = | subdivision_name1 = Mafraq Governorate | subdivision_type1 = Governorate | subdivision_name = | subdivision_type = Country | pushpin_map_caption = Location in Jordan | pushpin_mapsize = 300 | footnotes = }} Zaatari refugee camp is a refugee camp. It is located in Jordan, about from the Syrian border. It is one of the world's largest refugee camps."Refugee Camp for Syrians in Jordan Evolves as a Do-It-Yourself City" "Refugee Camp for Syrians in Jordan Evolves as a Do-It-Yourself City"]. by Michael Kimmelman in The New York Times 4 July 2014 it is the world's largest camp for Syrian refugees. It developed into a permanent setltement, with a main street, and a market along the main street. In August 2015, UNHCR estimated a population of 79.900 people. The camp covers an area of about . Over time, Zaatari has grown to be Jordan's fourth-largest settlement. ==References== Category:Settlements in Jordan Category:Refugee camps
title: Zaatari
